item.title: AWS IAM for Logging
item.description: History The saying goes that developer documentation is full of lies (the words of the great xbrianh). The longer I work with Cloud Platforms the more I realize this is true, and that there are strange inconsistencies within the API. In the case of AWS, you use IAM policies to allow/disallow access to resources/actions between you internal infrastructure. e.g. { "Version": "2012-10-17", "Statement": [{ "Sid": "AllowLambdaInvocation", "Effect": "Allow", "Action": [ "lambda:InvokeFunction", "lambda:InvokeAsync" ], "Resource": "arn:aws:lambda:*:*:function:*" }] } For the most part these are manually managed, when you want to use a resource, you have to define the policy that
